pr_title: Add GitHub actions for required jobs

timeline.message:
Add GitHub actions for required jobs

Signed-off-by: Alexander Scheel <ascheel@redhat.com>

Add GitHub actions for required jobs

Signed-off-by: Alexander Scheel <ascheel@redhat.com>

Add GitHub actions for required jobs

Signed-off-by: Alexander Scheel <ascheel@redhat.com>

timeline.bodyText:
Can this be simple as:
on: [push, pull_request]
timeline.author: SilleBille
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,25 @@
+name: Required Tests
+
+on:
+  push:
+    branches:
+    - master
+  pull_request:
+    branches:
+    - master

replies.bodyText:
Nope. If you do that, pull_requests, when opened, will have each job run twice. That's not... desirable so this lets you have status both on pull_request opening against master, and also when it gets pushed to master (on merge).
See: https://github.community/t5/GitHub-Actions/How-to-trigger-an-action-on-push-or-pull-request-but-not-both/td-p/35805
And: https://help.github.com/en/actions/automating-your-workflow-with-github-actions/events-that-trigger-workflows
replies.author: cipherboy

replies.bodyText: The other issue is that we want to only run this CI for master. Unlike Travis (where each branch has its own .travis.yml, workflows  only get picked up from the default (read: master) branch: https://github.community/t5/GitHub-Actions/Workflow-files-only-picked-up-from-master/td-p/30348
replies.author: cipherboy

replies.bodyText:
ACK.
Also, this documentation is confusing. It says ... push or pull request. From this PR's PoV, your second comment negates this issue :)
replies.author: SilleBille

timeline.bodyText:
Can this be simple as:
on: [push, pull_request]
timeline.author: SilleBille
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,53 @@
+name: Optional Tests
+
+on:
+  push:
+    branches:
+    - master
+  pull_request:
+    branches:
+    - master
